intro: Phyllanthus hakgalensis, commonly known as the Korean phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to South Korea. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Its fruit is a capsule that contains tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
